conflicts.description: The `conflicts` field is similar to the `dependencies` field in the core Foundry VTT manifest specification, but provides a mapping of packages which can not interoperate with the given package.

name.description: The name of the conflict package.
name.title: Conflict Package Name

type.description: The type of the conflict package
type.title: Conflict Package Type

versionMax.description: Defines a maximum version number for the package within which the conflict occurs.
versionMax.errorMessage: should be a string or number
versionMax.title: Conflict Maximum Version

versionMin.description: Defines a minimum version number for the package within which the conflict occurs.
versionMin.errorMessage: should be a string or number
versionMin.title: Conflict Minimum Version

conflicts.title: Conflicts

deprecated.description: This field is intended to be added to the manifest of a package that is no longer being maintained and / or is no longer functional / useful.

alternatives.description: An array of objects each providing data about another package which could act as a replacement for the deprecated package.

manifest.description: The URL of the manifest for the alternative package from which it can be downloaded.
manifest.title: Alternate Package Manifest

alternatives.title: Alternatives

coreVersion.description: If set the package is assumed to be a module that has been deprecated by a Foundry VTT core update. This field is the core version number as a string.
coreVersion.title: Core Version

reason.description: A human-readable string explaining why the package was deprecated.
examples: This was added to foundry core.
reason.title: Reason

deprecated.title: Deprecated

includes.description: The `includes` field is an array of strings where each string is a relative file path that should be included in the package zip archive.
includes.title: Includes

library.description: The `library` field is a boolean that indicates whether the package is a library intended for other packages to depend on and consume.
library.title: Library

manifestPlusVersion.description: Denotes which version of Manifest+ you have implemented.
manifestPlusVersion.title: Manifest+ Version

media.description: An array of objects that each provide data for a single multimedia item. This data includes a `type` field which indicates what kind of media is being provided as well as an `url` field which provides the address of the media resource.
media.title: Media
